title: Old Bay-Seasoned Steamed Shrimp Recipe
description: Steamed shrimp flavored with Old Bay seasoning is perfect for a quick and easy dinner or appetizer, loaded with peppery and smoky flavor.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe: Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Seafood Shellfish Shrimp Old Bay-Seasoned Steamed Shrimp 4.8 (28) 26 Reviews 5 Photos Easy, spicy, steamed shrimp with Old Bay seasoning. Great for a super-quick dinner with a salad. Submitted by Karen Schroeder Caselli Updated on February 8, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 5 5 5 5 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ½ cup water ½ cup white vinegar 2 tablespoons seafood seasoning (such as Old Bay) 1 pound fresh large shrimp, deveined with shells on Directions Bring water, vinegar, and seafood seasoning to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Add shrimp and stir. Reduce heat to medium, cover, and steam, stirring once or twice, until bright orange in color, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain. I Made It Print 92 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 88 Calories 1g Fat 19g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 88 % Daily Value * Total Fat 1g 1% Saturated Fat 0g 2% Cholesterol 173mg 58% Sodium 954mg 41% Protein 19g 37% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 35mg 3% Iron 3mg 15% Potassium 161mg 3% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. Add Your Photo Photos of Old Bay-Seasoned Steamed Shrimp 01 of 05 Photo by  France C 02 of 05 Photo by  SandyGin2696 06/19/2023 I loved this recipe as it was my 1st time making my own Old Bay Steamed Shrimp! I did 1 cup of water and added a 3/4 cup of white vinegar than tripled up on the Old Bay Seasoning since I had more than a pound of shrimp! Turned out better than some of the store bought Steamed shrimp I've tried. I also added more Old Bay after I cooked and drained them cuz I like them spicy! 03 of 05 Photo by  NiftyHam7841 05/11/2023 Quick, easy and very tasty 04 of 05 Photo by  France C 09/28/2022 Very tasty and flavorful shrimp! Mine were perfectly cooked at 3 minutes. I only had shelled shrimp on hand, so that’s what I used, and it still worked out well. 2 tablespoons seems like a lot of seasoning, but it works! 05 of 05 Photo by  Karen Schroeder Caselli 10/31/2011 1 You’ll Also Love Steamed Garlic Prawns, Chinese Style 12 Ratings Easy Grilled Shrimp 1 Rating Spicy Steamed Shrimp 61 Ratings Malaysian Lady Fingers (Okra) 1 Rating Blackened Shrimp 8 Ratings Sweet and Spicy Grilled Shrimp 55 Ratings Baked Amberjack 4 Ratings Pan-Fried Shrimp 43 Ratings Tilapia in Stewed Tomatoes 9 Ratings Quick Oven-Baked Shrimp 2 Ratings Jumbo Shrimp and Asparagus 106 Ratings Alaskan Cod and Shrimp with Fresh Tomato 202 Ratings Steamed Mussels II 79 Ratings Japanese Shrimp Sauce II 57 Ratings Easy Breaded Shrimp 129 Ratings Air-Fried Shrimp 15 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Karen Schroeder Caselli
instructions: Bring water, vinegar, and seafood seasoning to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Add shrimp and stir.;Reduce heat to medium, cover, and steam, stirring once or twice, until bright orange in color, 3 to 5 minutes. Drain.
